Text.Value: But... aye. Might be we've drawn enough attention to this place.
But we've gabbed enough. You got something to trade or what?
Oh? More steel than the entire Zhentarim? Cos that's who you're crossing if you try to scab me on a deal.
Sounds fair. I'll take a portrait, then.
All right mate, all right. Waukeen's clipped coins, there's no need to get arsey.
These artsy tossers always have friends in high places. That's why they're valuable.
Counter-offer. Come back with coin, and I'll pretend you're as scary as you think you are.
Then what? You going to kill the entire Zhentarim next? Good luck, prick.
All right mate, all right - no need to get arsey about it.
Take the moany bastard, if he means that much to ya. Doubt his crap would sell anyway.

EditorData.StateChangeTags: The prisoner artist is now free.

Text.Value: No, thanks - I just want to trade.
I don't have that kind of money.
Leave.
He's all yours. Don't forget to feed him - he bawls something proper.

EditorData.StateChangeTags: The prisoner artist is now free.

Text.Value: I do cut a fine figure. I'll take one.
Pay him.
If you have the gold, my pet artist will make you a most heroical likeness.
Something I can help you with?
Go on, then - but don't kill him here. He's going to be a bleater, I know it.

EditorData.StateChangeTags: The prisoner artist is now free.

Text.Value: Art's more valuable once the creator is dead. I can arrange that.
You looking to buy him? I'm open to offers, mate. Threats, not so much.
He's not a pet, he's a prisoner - let him go.
Can't show you the good stuff 'til Zarys gives the say-so, mind. Friends of the Zhent only.
Hey - I was just looking to make a little coin. Ain't after a mess.
Leave.
Pay him.
THEN LOWER THE PRICE. OR DIE.
Too much. Cut your price down to size or I'll cut you down to size.
The price is the price. Pay up or get lost.
I'm here to buy your prisoner.

EditorData.logicalname: Player knows the artist was kidnapped.

Text.Value: I want to trade.
It's not the art I want to buy - it's the artist.
Well now! If we're talking, my guess is you've got coin to spend.
Plenty, if the finer things don't appeal.
Then it's the same price I gave you before. No more haggling. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
If he's as talented as you say, someone will be looking for him.
Leave.
I expect so. And whoever wants him had best bring a heap of coin.
You've got an eye for quality. Every noble in Baldur's Gate will be after one of these.
I doubt you've got that kinda dosh lying about. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Let's say we're his patrons, yeah? Found him wandering the wilds alone.
Tell him I sent you - and if he stains it up with his sniffling, there'll be hell to pay.

Aye, off my rocker me - so you'd best not push me too far, eh? Price is the price. 
([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Aye? Back already?
Look, mate - this don't have to get violent, right? You want him, pay for him.
ROAR.
If you have the gold, my pet artist will make you a most heroical likeness. Follow the whining.
Pleasure.
Go on then. But anything lower would be criminal. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
Do you have anything else to trade?
Slavekeeping's bad for business with any halfway-moral customer. Let him go.
All right, so maybe I was fishing. No fooling you. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
What, kill him and the price of his drawings goes up? Bloody clever, that.
Fancy that - so do I.
You have a 'pet artist'?
Fine, I'll buy him. How much?
Forget the artist - do you have anything else to trade?
I don't have that much gold. I have plenty of steel, though.
Well don't you cut a fine figure. Want your portrait done?
We can skip threats and go straight to blades, if you like.
Been there, mate. Come back when you've coin, and we can talk, eh?
'Protection'. It sounds a bit more like kidnapping.
He needs protection. And if his paintings cover our costs - so much the better, eh?
What, reckon I can't deal with him myself? It's not a bad idea, mind...
I don't have that kind of money.
Of course. Got some interesting stock for a friend of the family.
Something I can help you with?
You're insane if you think I'm going to pay that much.
Here's my offer: give me your slave, or become mine.
If this artist were to tragically expire, his portfolio would become finite - therefore priceless.

Synopsis: Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.
